Description: Chian pottery plastic head, originally attached to one side of a handle of a black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery vessel; white slip; exterior: female head with painted facial features and dotted necklace and possible headdress; two added red bands on top of head; row of reserved dots on forehead; vertical reserved band with black horizontal strokes on either side of face and neck; below, black line and raised fillet with black dots.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AΠ55 (west of the central part of the temenos)
Curator's comments: For a discussion on plastic heads, see Lemos 1991, 140. For parallels, see Lemos no. 1438 from Phana, upon which numerous plastic heads appear on the handle of a bell-shaped vase. The Sphinx and Lion Style is very clear on the body of the vase. The fitting possibly came from a bowl. See British Museum 1888,0601.456. 'AΠ55' is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 317, no. 1379, pl. 177.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2065) (phase 2)
